intro: Cyperus neocooperi, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like appearance and cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences. Native to wetland environments, it thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
